author: Juan Montes
title: Mexico’s Multibillion-Dollar Airport Project Is Well Under Way. It May Be Canceled
text:
TEXCOCO, Mexico—Every day, some 6,000 trucks loaded with everything from earth to steel girders rumble through here to build Latin America’s biggest airport. But all this frenetic activity on the northeastern outskirts of Mexico City could soon end.
Andrés Manuel López Obrador, a leftist-nationalist politician who is the clear front-runner ahead of July’s presidential election, has vowed to cancel the capital’s new $13.3 billion project if he wins, turning opposition to it into a rallying cry of his campaign.
...
